title: Commercial Internet eXchange (CIX) Formed
overview: CIX is established in the US to allow commercial ISPs to interconnect outside the NSFNET, catalyzing the growth of the commercial Internet.

title: AMS-IX Founded
overview: The Amsterdam Internet Exchange (AMS-IX) is founded, becoming one of the largest IXPs in the world and a hub for European traffic exchange.

title: North American Network Operators’ Group (NANOG)
overview: NANOG forms to bring together operators for technical coordination, troubleshooting, and best practices in Internet operations.

title: LINX Founded
overview: The London Internet Exchange (LINX) is established, quickly becoming one of the world’s most important interconnection hubs.

title: DE-CIX Becomes Independent
overview: The Deutscher Commercial Internet Exchange (DE-CIX) in Frankfurt becomes an independent association, later evolving into the world’s largest IXP by traffic.

title: AfNOG Created
overview: The African Network Operators Group (AfNOG) is established to build skills, community, and technical cooperation across African ISPs and NRENs.

title: SANOG Created
overview: The South Asian Network Operators Group (SANOG) is created to support training, policy discussions, and peering growth in South Asia.

title: LACNOG Created
overview: The Latin America and Caribbean Network Operators Group (LACNOG) is created, fostering operational knowledge sharing across the LACNIC region.

title: MENOG Created
overview: The Middle East Network Operators Group (MENOG) launches to strengthen the operator community across the Middle East and Gulf region.

title: BalticNOG Established
overview: BalticNOG is established as a Network Operators Group to bring together ISPs, enterprises, and researchers across the Baltic States for collaboration and knowledge sharing.
